text:
An underappreciated near-future dynamic is one where human surveillance state capitalism is replaced by an AGI panopticonâ€¦

Where every packet is sniffed by networks of autonomous LLMs, hungry for every digital morselâ€¦

Where the internet becomes a dark forestâ€¦

We need to be building tools now (a la @jack ) to keep lit the fragile flame of human sovereigntyâ€¦ 

â€œThe mathematicians who participated had to sign a nondisclosure agreement requiring them to communicate solely via the messaging app Signal. Other forms of contact, such as traditional e-mail, could potentially be scanned by an LLM and inadvertently train it, thereby contaminating the dataset.â€

text:
Bill Pulte (FHFA attack dog), former Governor Kevin Warsh, NEC head Kevin Hassett, Vance, & Trump have each publicly framed the $2.5B Fed-HQ renovation as evidence of Powellâ€™s â€œmismanagement,â€ signalling a choreographed effort to depict the overrun as statutory â€œcauseâ€ for dismissal.

Under 12 U.S.C. Â§ 242â€“244, a Board member â€œmay be removed *for cause* by the President,â€ and any vacancy in the Chair is automatically filled by the Vice Chairâ€”presently Philip Jeffersonâ€”until a new Chair is Senate-confirmed.

If Trump fires Powell (which would conveniently move the news cycle off of Epstein), JP would likely seek an immediate injunction, arguing that Humphreyâ€™s Executor v. US protects multi-member independent-agency governors from at-will removal, but this clash would test that precedent in light of recent cases (Seila Law and Collins).

While courts weigh the challenge, the WH must nominate a successor and navigate Senate Banking hearings (or consider a recess appointment).

We could thus have a situation with:

A Fired Fed Chair appealing for reinstatement, 
An Acting Fed Chair that nobody has ever heard of, and
A Shadow Fed Chair eager to telegraph a very different policy direction.

Imagine the policy vol in that environmentâ€¦.

Bitcoin is sniffing something outâ€¦
